column2: The correct type, configuration, size, quantity split and fill out
Correct depth & following the correct route
Has the correct length, breadth, depth
Check that the re-inforcing materials are the correct type, size & quantity
Check that the rag-bolt assembly is correct type and properly positioned/orientation
Check that the lighting pole is :
The correct type, size and colour
Confirm that the assembly has been installed in a workmanlike manner
Confirm the pole has sufficient cabling pathway for Comms wiring
Confirm draw wires have been installed
Testing (QA_FRM_005_Final Installation Test Sheet and relevant ITC's Completed and Signed)

Earthing installation as per Electrical Earthing Layout 
* attach drawing highlighting inspected installation.

Earthing networks segregated i.e., Clean Earth segregated from protective earth, intrinsically safe earth segregated from protective earth etc. 
(where applicable).
All conductors are suitably protected against mechanical damage.
Conductive water piping has been bonded to the earthing system (AS/NZS 3000 5.6.2.2) - include photographic evidence.
Conductive reinforcing within a concrete floor or wall of a room containing a shower or bath has been bonded to the earthing system (AS/NZS 3000 5.6.2.5) - include photographic evidence.

Swimming Pools and Spas
Equipotential bonding conductor connected to the conductive pool structure, electrical equipment, conductive fixtures and fittings, and earthing conductors associated with each circuit supplying the pool or spa (AS/NZS 3000 5.6.2.6) - include photographic evidence.

If the telephone and telecommunication earthing system is directly connected to the electrical installation earthing system, the requirements of AS/NZS 3000 5.6.2.7 have been met and the Communications Earth Terminal (CET) is labeled "COMMUNICATIONS EARTH TERMINAL".

Continuity of the earthing system meets the requirements of AS/NZS 3000 8.3.5.
Resistance of the main earthing conductor or any equipotential bonding conductor is not more than 0.5 Ω. 
* attach drawing identifying Test Points & record results below. (use additional table if more points required)
Equipotential bonding requirements as listed in AS/NZS 3000 5.6.2.1 have been completed.

Confirm the completion of QA-TEM_004_Trench and Backfill (all tasks prior to backfilling) has not raised any non-conformances.
Photograph trench showing correct depth.
Hold Point - Prior to installation of pits
The correct type, configuration, size, quantity of access holes
Correct depth & following the correct route

Photograph trench detail showing correct installation method.
Photograph trench showing 150mm Sand covering all conduits and installation of detectable marking tape.
Conduits are cleaned, rodded and roped
